Topic.Title: new base forming

Message.Msg: i agree but disagree! yes a base has been formed in this type of every day going up market! get a diff. market (dow more down than up- esp. large ones) & you will see yahoo alot lower! yahoo lost it's every market type base when it reneged about the cash going to shareholders! previously- market up or down & either way little change in yahoo's price! cash return to shareholders- big plus in down market-NOT ANYMORE UNLESS SOME OF IT IS RETURNED TO SHAREHOLDERS! ( lost a lot of trust in company!) lots of cos. in a down market had enormous amounts of cash on their books but it didn't stop the shares from substantial drops! shareholder weren't going to get the cash!

Message.Title: New COO, Another Exec. Piggy Bank
Message.Msg: Another executive, $millions in bonuses, lots of free options, etc before he/she does a day's work. This is a piggy bank for the board and it's executive officers....it never ends!! I also read that Mayer is leaning on Founder David Filo for input. Where has this guy been for the last 5 years, other than to the bank counting his riches as he cashes out 150,000 shares every month? If he had any ideas, wouldn't they have come forth already? God bless the shareholders.

Message.Msg: New COO sounds like an entirely reasonable and valuble step forward, leaning on David Filo for knowledge and background is also smart. I am new and intend to be long.

Message.Title: Marissa Mayer inexperienced as CEO
Message.Msg: Marissa Mayer inexperienced as CEO as she has never ever been in such position even at a small start up. She's great techie but lets see how she can perform given seasoned past CEO's like Terry Semel and Carol Bartz failed to revive this company imho

Topic.Title: hard to believe these doofusses

Message.Msg: Last 3 months is a reflection of DAN LOEB, including the head scratching hiring of Melissa Mayer. So far Loeb has kicked and screamed about getting three seats on the board- he can't blame the board from that point forward. He authorized the Alibaba deal to convert shares to cash- he supported that plan. Where is the cash? Is there a deadline or Jack Ma can just "try" to raise $$ into 2013 ? He authorized Yahoo Japan sale, months later what happened, no updates, no one knows. He fired Thompson and used it as an opportunity to assert his power as a shareholder and approved Levinsohn as Interim CEO and less than two months DUMPED Levinsohn and bear hugged Melissa and told the BOD he found the greatest CEO solution for YHOO. Meanwhile stock drifts weakly, no strength, no news worth looking forward to, and now rescind his plan to distribute Alibaba $$ to stockholders and told the pregnant lady to tell the world her first big decision as CEO. Dan Loeb is much worse than advertised. He thumped his chest, now he showed us he is just as clueless in unlocking value in YHOO franchise or the simple breakup of YHOO to unlock value. With all that billions and controlling of YHOO, he is under water on this investment. Dan Loeb and his infactuation for Melissa so far has proved he might not be the right person to manage his investors $$Billions.

Message.Title: Stuck In The Mud in the $14s....Soon $13s!!!
Message.Msg: Sure looks like she is headed back to the $8s-$9s like a few years ago. They have effectively Destroyed this Company. EVERY CEO and BOD member has milked it for millions of dollars...EVERY ONE!! Now the website is the laughingstock of the Internet. Virtually NOTHING on the Finance website works correctly and the Message Boards....well, they've been taken over by the likes of coldone and his 88 aliases. Sad, sad, sad......In a few years someone will buy Yahoo for $10 share and it will be all over with. DESTRUCTION!

Message.Msg: ...some other buyer. MM could not turn YHOO around even if she had CEO experience and were not havinga baby.

Message.Title: It just takes 1 BIG announcement!
Message.Msg: either a big hire, Alibaba money finally in our hands, a well known acquisition, the sale of Yahoo Japan finalized.....but these will take time but the pop will be 2-3 points, then the 2nd pop will be another 2-3 points....We are finally on the right path......Patience my children!!

Topic.Title: It just takes 1 BIG announcement!

Message.Msg: Yahoo will have multiple big announcements over the next two months. Yahoo Japan will be sold, Alibaba Group will pay Yahoo for 50% of Yahoo's Alibaba stake, there will be many big hires including anew CFO and a COO. Yahoo will make a big acquisition. If I were you I would buy Yahoo under $15 while you cab like the coldone said to do.

Topic.Title: It just takes 1 BIG announcement!

Message.Msg: Yes BUT....How long are these events going to take before fruition??? Are these guys just naturally incompetent?? I'm beginning to think that a SALE is the ONLY way for YHOO.

Topic.Title: It just takes 1 BIG announcement!

Topic.Title: hard to believe these doofusses

Message.Msg: i totally agree and now it makes no sense to get rid of Alibaba. 40% is huge and it's time to dig in with Jack Ma.

Message.Title: again, just 1 big announcemnt!
Message.Msg: Yahoo never went up for years because of bad decisions and an incompetent BOD and of course it all started with Jerry Yang after turning down Microsoft's offer. After many years of incompetency, I feel we are finally on the right road back.....did I want to see some of Alibaba's money coming back to me....for sure yes but after thinking about it and having lots of Lobe's money tied up as well....he backed the change of heart for using the money for major acquisitions and getting Yahoo back on their feet again....It for sure wont happen overnight but if you're a believer just stay the course......if you are not, stop complaining and sell!!! Don't forget this quarter we had the Olympics where Yahoo had a huge number of hits and had easily the best coverage.

Message.Title: Not Yahoo's fault
Message.Msg: All this time i thought my slow and glitchy Yahoo page loading was Yahoo's fault. I tried all IE fixes, but nothing worked. Finally switched over to Firefox to see if that would help and it was like getting a new computer with double the RAM. All Yahoo pages now load just as fast as everything else. I have been a Softie backer for all these years, but I am now totally done with its crummy products and will soon go all Apple as my friends have pushed me to do for years. Held out for so long I now feel like a dummy but am glad I finally saw the light. Sorry for slamming you, Yahoo.

Smart man Loeb, try to patch up the mistake.

Message.Title: Now if YHOO had moved up a buck from $16 to $17 instead of down to $15 during Mayer's first...
Message.Msg: ...month I would not be thrilled, but would be happy and think she might have been a good choice despite the many obvious reasons she probably is not. It is absurd YHOO is so low with Naz. up so much (over 17%) this year. Is it that the market simply does not trust Jack Ma to come through?? With AG growth (if the numbers are true) Ma should be able to sell more of AG at a $50 bil value (for entire co.) now and close the YHOO deal and even get YHOO an extra bil or two from first 20% and have YHOO's other 20% worth $10 bil. And why can't they get a deal done with Y-Jap? YHOO owns big stakes in these Asian companies yet never has any pull or say.
